resources.string: Hello!\nThis app will show you different ways of managing data in android

Assets is a data in apk of your application

 Pros: Data always comes with application

 Cons: You can't modify it

 You can use it when you need some data (text files, images, songs) available after installing.

 In this example you can display assets directory and load picture from assets.

Internal storage allows you to store data of your application. This data are private by default.

 Pros: Internal storage is always available. Files private by default.

 Cons: Files deletes with uninstalling of app.

 In this example you can create file in internal storage and then open it. Additionally, you can create cache file in internal storage. You can try delete cache in phone settings and notice what kind of files has been vanished.

External storage.

 Pros: There is more space than in internal storage.

 Cons: It's not always available. data is public. 

 In this example you can create, open and delete .txt files in public and private directories.
Shared preferences allows you to save key-value pairs of primitive data types.\n\n You can keep user\'s preferences and settings in shared preferences.
SQLite is a database, which provides ability to save a lot of data.\n\n In this example you can add value to database and clear all values.

Content provider allows other applications access to private data. \n\Firstly, you can access system contacts and load information to our sql database and look at in sqlite section (tab right). Secondly, you can run Content Provider Demo and load data from this application in another.
